result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jennifer S Drexler

records.addlTxt: Status conference on October 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on August 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.

01:40 PM Defendant Jennifer S Drexler in court with attorney Bradley J Jansen, via zoom.   Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Jansen has copy of complaint, waives reading and enters Not Guilty plea.  Court receives Not Guilty plea. Atty Jansen heard on bond and would request returned to poster and put under Signature bond.  Court declines request. Bond continues  Status conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.

02:11 PM Defendant Jennifer S Drexler in court.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom.  Court reviews history of case. Def. is eligible for PD and will wait.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. Maintain absolute sobriety.

01:23 PM Defendant Jennifer S Drexler in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jennifer S Drexler appeared by video means. All parties via zoom. Def. is advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Defendant wishes to have council. ADA gives bond argument and recommendation. ADA recommends $500 cash bail and no illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license and maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant gives response. Court gives ruling. Court rules to a $250 cash bail and with conditions of no presence in establishments with Class B liquor license, no illegal use or possession of controlled substances. Court is adjourned.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
